story.storykicker: The first batch of 25 Candidates were flagged off by Army at Chinar Corps. Another 04 candidates will join from Udhampur thereby making it 29 candidates from Jammu and Kashmir to Tata Motors Limited, Ropar, Punjab.
story.storybody:
In a distinct initiative, Army joins hands with Tata Motors to ameliorate the opportunities for unemployed Kashmiri youth through Youth Development Module of Tata Motors Limited. The first batch of 25 Candidates were flagged off by Army at Chinar Corps. Another 04 candidates will join from Udhampur thereby making it 29 candidates  from J&K to Tata Motors Limited, Ropar, Punjab where these candidates will be undergoing 03 months Technician Course in Automobile stream through latest techniques tools and equipments.

ENHANCING VOCATIONAL SKILL

Speaking on occasion, Lt Gen Satish Dua, Chinar Corps Commander said that the aim of this employment drive is to ensure that the youth of Jammu and Kashmir gets an opportunity to enhance their vocational skills, sets benchmark for others to emulate and channelise energy of youth in constructive way. According to Mr Sanjeev Garg, Vice president and Global head, Tata Motors Limited the motive of this collaboration with Army is that we are desirous to create quality standards in skill development industry and assist in increasing employment opportunities for the youth. The excitement among the candidates was clearly visible as most of them were moving out of the region for the first time.

CREATING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES

Army has come up in a big way to enhance the employment opportunities for the local youth by imparting technical training to the youth so that their futures can be secured. All candidate expressed their deep gratitude to the Army and Tata Motors Limited for giving them the life time opportunity for growth and self development.

ALSO READ: Army undertakes war games to deal with a nuclear attack

story.shortheadline: Army commences certified training programme with Tata Motors for Kashmiri youth
